LanguageData.Squirrel.label: squirrel
LanguageData.Squirrel.description: A squirrel is one of the many hardy, versatile rodent species that follows humankind everywhere it spreads.
LanguageData.Alphabeaver.label: alphabeaver
LanguageData.Alphabeaver.description: A large beaver derivative genetically engineered to harvest 목재 with machine-like efficiency. In the absence of specialized feed, these animals will enter a manic state that compels them to eat trees whole.
LanguageData.Capybara.label: capybara
LanguageData.Capybara.description: A cabybara is the largest known natural rodent. Capybaras are well-adapted for hot environments, such as steaming jungles.
LanguageData.Chinchilla.label: chinchilla
LanguageData.Chinchilla.description: A Chinchilla is a small but quick rodent that is famous for its exceptionally soft fur.
LanguageData.Boomrat.label: boomrat
LanguageData.Boomrat.description: Either by deliberate genetic weaponization, or as an unusual defense 기계장치 these rodent-like creatures create a powerful fire-starting explosion when killed.
LanguageData.Raccoon.label: raccoon
LanguageData.Raccoon.description: A small, hardy animal that ranges wide across forests and shrubland. Eats almost anything.
LanguageData.Rat.label: rat
LanguageData.Rat.description: A rodent famous for soiling kitchens and spreading disease. Eats almost anything; lives almost anywhere.
LanguageData.Chipmunk.label: 청설모
LanguageData.Chipmunk.description: A small rodent famous for its ability to over-stuff its cheeks with an absurd amount of food.
